text:
Hi <@U6W3H6YN8>! I have a question regarding your comment
> We are still working on making the GraphQL API work with oAuth and private apps! For now it only works with an API key
Do you have any kind of estimation about it? When it will be possible? We are very excited about ability to use GraphQL! Thank you!

Hello!
I have a question regarding filters in *GraphQL*.
For example, if I want to search *Companies* by list of `domains,` I have to make separate query for each `domain`, as `domain` doesn’t have operator `__in` (allows to pass multiple values in array)

Do you have intentions to add this ability? Or how could I filter `Companies/Contact` with multiple values for the same field? If field doesn’t have associated operator `__in`.

Thank you for opportunity to use GraphQL!
Hey <@U03CSJ4AN4B>! Good question - to confirm, are you talking about how the domain field can have multiple values as seen in this photo?

The `__in` filter will only show up for enumeration type properties, whereas this property is a text field property. We will think more about how we might be able to support what you are trying to do for the properties where we support multiple values in text fields.
<@U03CSJ4AN4B> we are actively working on it, so hopefully relatively soon. I will report back when it is ready!
<@U024L8W0MB6> actually pointed out to me the non-primary domains get stored in an `hs_additional_domains`, which does support `__in`, however, that property does not contain the primary domain.
<@U6W3H6YN8> and <@U024L8W0MB6> thank you guys for your fast response! Yep, I am looking for filtering  `primary` domains with multiple values.

Hi! One more question regarding *GraphQL,* if you don’t mind. Can we retrieve <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/marketing/contact-lists|contacts> or companies list? I couldn’t find something related inside Documentation Explorer. Thank you!

Good question! Not at this moment, but that is certainly an interesting idea. To make sure I understand the use case, why do you want to fetch the contents of a list, as opposed to fetching the data directly?
